  2) Increasing c-axis spacing monotonically stabilizes (lowers energy of) the octahedral state over some meaningful range, as implied by the unqualified wording.

  • Contradictions: The universal/monotonic implication (“increasing spacing stabilizes”) fails beyond a narrow window; structural integrity of the octahedron is not maintained in the reported relaxations.
- Why not other scores:

  • 0: Evidence is not merely insufficient; it leans against the claim as written (non-monotonic trend, octahedral degradation).  
  • +1/+2: The claim’s generality is contradicted; octahedral preservation is not demonstrated and larger expansions destabilize.
